## Review notes

As usual please review the probability & inference sections we covered this past week. Make sure you understand each of the following key concepts:

 - CDFs and inverse CDFs
 - Normal functions:
   - Parameters

   - QQ plots

 - Normal approximation of binomial:

 - Roughly what the LLN means
 - Formula and interpretation of confidence intervals

2. Practice plotting the normal PDF, CDF, and inverse CDF functions (you can borrow code from lecture)

```{r}

x <- seq(-4, 4, length=100)

# PDF plot
plot(x, dnorm(x), type='l', main='Normal PDF', ylab='Density', xlab='x')

# CDF plot
plot(x, pnorm(x), type='l', main='Normal CDF', ylab='Probability', xlab='x')

# Inverse CDF plot
p <- seq(0, 1, length=100)
plot(p, qnorm(p), type='l', main='Normal Inverse CDF', ylab='Quantile', xlab='Probability')



```
